stimulusHtml: The changes in the distribution of cities in the period 1200 to 1400 C.E. best support which of the following conclusions?

features.html: Data adapted from David Wilkinson, “Cities, Civilizations and Oikumenes,” Comparative Civilizations Review: Vols. 27 and 28: Nos. 27 and 28, 1992–1993

choicesHtml: The Mongol conquests had a more disruptive impact on the Middle East and Central Asia than they had on East Asia.
The emergence of the Ottoman Empire significantly increased the percentage of major urban centers in Europe.
The adoption of Champa rice during the Song dynasty significantly increased the share of China’s urban population.
The outbreaks of bubonic plague greatly reduced urban populations across Eurasia.
